animation
Class Animator

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  animation.Animator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Animator
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

An animator is responsible for driving the physical simulation of the motion of a collection of live objects, and for keeping the screen display up-to-date.

See Also:
Serialized Form

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
Routine called back by the animation timer to let us know that it is time to update the simulation.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

addLiveObject

public void addLiveObject(liveobject.LiveObject object)
Register an object to be managed and displayed by the animator.

Parameters:
object - The object to be registered.

allLiveObjects

public java.util.Iterator<liveobject.LiveObject> allLiveObjects()
Iterator for enumerating all live objects currently being managed. This is useful, for example, so that an object can check whether it has collided with another object.

Returns:
An enumeration object to generate all the live objects.

drawArc

public void drawArc(java.awt.Graphics g,
                    geometry.Vector2D position,
                    double radius,
                    double startAngle,
                    double stopAngle)
Utility method for drawing a circular arc according to the current screen size and resolution.

Parameters:
g - Graphics context in which to draw.
position - Position of the center of the arc.
radius - Radius of the arc.
startAngle - Starting angle in degrees.
stopAngle - Stopping angle in degrees.

drawSegment

public void drawSegment(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        geometry.Segment2D seg)
Utility method for drawing a line segment according to the current screen size and resolution.

Parameters:
g - Graphics context in which to draw.
seg - 2D segment to be drawn.

public double getFrameRate()
Accessor for getting the frame rate.

Returns:
the frame rate.

getFrameTime

public double getFrameTime()
Accessor for getting the time per frame.

Returns:
the time per frame, in seconds.

getResolution

public double getResolution()
Obtain the current screen resolution.

Returns:
the current resolution in pixels per AU.

setDone

public void setDone()
Method used by the lower levels to notify us that the game has terminated.

setFrameRate

public void setFrameRate(double hz)
Mutator for setting the number of updates per frame.

Parameters:
hz - The number of frames per second.

setUpdatesPerFrame

public void setUpdatesPerFrame(int n)
Mutator for setting the update rate for the physical calculations.

Parameters:
n - The number of steps of the physical simulation per frame.

toPixels

public geometry.Segment2D toPixels(geometry.Segment2D seg)
Utility method for converting model to pixel coordinates, according to the current display panel size and resolution.

Parameters:
seg - 2D segment to be converted to pixel coordinates.
Returns:
a 2D segment giving the corresponding pixel coordinates.

toPixels

public geometry.Vector2D toPixels(geometry.Vector2D vec)
Utility method for converting model to pixel coordinates, according to the current display panel size and resolution.

Parameters:
vec - 2D vector to be converted to pixel coordinates.
Returns:
a 2D vector giving the corresponding pixel coordinates.
